item.title: Our top 3 and bottom 3 stocks since Trump's reciprocal tariffs rocked Wall Street
item.description: Since the Club's March Monthly Meeting, the market has had one of its most volatile weeks ever.

item.title: United Airlines gives two 2025 profit outlooks, calling economy 'impossible' to predict
item.description: United Airlines said a deterioration in bookings could lead it to lower its 2025 outlook to $7 to $9 a share from $11.50 to $13.50.

item.title: Critical chip firm ASML misses order expectations amid tariff uncertainty
item.description: ASML reported net bookings of 3.94 billion euros ($4.47 billion) for the first quarter, versus a Reuters reported forecast of 4.89 billion euros.

item.title: Bank of America tops analysts' estimates on better-than-expected interest income, trading
item.description: Bank of America shares have sold off in recent weeks on concern that President Donald Trump's tariff policies could cause a recession.

item.title: Citigroup results exceed analysts' estimates on gains in fixed income and equities trading
item.description: CEO Jane Fraser said Tuesday that the bank was continuing to earn credibility with investors and that she remains focused on executing on her strategy...
